newsitem.title: USA: TCI MUSIC TO ACQUIRE BOX WORLDWIDE.
newsitem.headline: TCI MUSIC TO ACQUIRE BOX WORLDWIDE.

text.p: Box Worldwide Inc and TCI Music Inc said Wednesday they have a definitive agreement for TCI Music to acquire Box Worldwide in a stock swap.
Common stock of Box Worldwide will be exchanged for shares of TCI Music's Series A preferred stock, with each share of Box Worldwide valued at $1.50.

Each share of the TCI Music preferred would be immediately convertible into three shares of TCI Music Series A common stock. The shares would be entitled to the same rights as the currently outstanding TCI Music common, other than its put feature.
TCI Music is managed by Liberty Media Corp, the programming unit of Tele-Communications Inc.

The merger is expected to close in the fourth quarter of this year. It is subject to regulatory approvals, the satisfaction of certain conditions in the merger agreement, the approval of Box Worldwide shareholders and its board of directors.
About 55 percent of Box Worldwide's shareholders have already agreed to vote their shares in favor of the merger. A 75-percent vote is required to approve the merger, the companies said.
